page.title: 09Home life in Sebergham
page.content: Homelife is still simple in the majority of homes, though the farm- houses and larger houses are now of a high standard. Heating throughout the house is usual in the majority of homes though the expense of running this these days means families are careful not to heat those parts of the house not in everyday use. Many country families keep dogs and cats as pets. The owner of the former Rectory built in 1876 having 2 horses 4 dogs 6 cats and a few hens for eggs. Farmers keep working dogs which are usually kennelled outside in buildings Three meals a day are usual though times of these vary depending on social group. Farmers start milking at 7am and again at 4pm, whilst at harvest time work long hours and even into the night with lights on their tractors.
